EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5). (Iron ore is transferred here for smelting; later, 38 iron plates were extracted.)
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Dedicated Output Chest for Iron Plates – Wooden Chest successfully placed at (0.5, 2.5) to deposit extracted iron plates from the furnace.
• Transport Belt Connection – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to the feeder inserter pickup (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5).
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore.
• Sink Chest – Wooden Chest at (-11.5, -46.5) serving as temporary ore storage.
• Sink Inserter – Burner Inserter at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5); recently refueled with coal (fuel: Inventory({'coal': 9})) and now operating with no warnings.
• Transport Belt Connection – BeltGroup connecting the mining drill drop at (-14.5, -48.5) to the sink inserter pickup at (-9.5, -46.5).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Placement Range and Buildability:
 – Always move close to the intended placement location and use the nearest_buildable function when direct placement fails.
• Undefined Variables and Nil References:
 – Ensure that all temporary variables and entity references are correctly initialized to prevent nil indexing.
• Occupied Tile Conflicts & Spacing Issues:
 – When placement errors occur due to an obstructed tile (e.g. failure to place an output chest adjacent to a furnace due to nearby transport belts or inserters), adjust spacing, change placement direction, or modify the reference position.
• Object Attribute and Method Misuse:
 – Avoid treating non-callable properties as functions. For example, use the center attribute of a buildable_area correctly rather than calling it as a function.
• Inventory and Crafting Requirements:
 – Confirm that required items are available in inventory before placement and that necessary technological recipes are unlocked prior to crafting (as seen with the assembling machine placement and crafting errors).
• Belt Connection Targeting:
 – Validate that connections between entities are correctly sequenced by inserting appropriate intermediary entities if direct linking fails.
• Fuel Shortages:
 – Monitor and replenish fuel on entities (like sink inserters and burner inserters) to maintain continuous operation.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.  
  • Success: Entity is repositioned correctly.  
  • Failure: Prototype mismatches may occur if identifier strings are not standardized.

• nearest_buildable(position: Position) -> BoundingBox  
 – Determines the nearest buildable area surrounding a given position for entity placement.  
  • Success: Returns a valid bounding box for placement.  
  • Failure: Misuse of property access can trigger errors.

• place_entity_next_to(prototype: Prototype, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Optional[Entity]  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the given prototype adjacent to a reference position based on the specified direction and spacing.  
  • Success: Returns the placed entity if the target cell is buildable and unoccupied.  
  • Failure: Returns an error if the target position is occupied or invalid.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
• mining_drill_drop (Position) – Stores the mining drill’s output drop position.
• target_chest_position (Position) – Represents the position of the attempted transport belt connection target.
